extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING AMOUNTS FOR FURTHER EXPENSES OF THE COMMITTEE ON ENERGY AND COMMERCE IN THE ONE HUNDRED FOURTEENTH CONGRESS; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 172

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Providing amounts for further expenses of the Committee on Energy and Commerce
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 933, providing amounts for further expenses of the Committee on Energy and Commerce in the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress, by a recorded vote of 234 ayes to 181 noes, Roll No. 595, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 177 nays, Roll No. 594.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Providing amounts for further expenses of the Committee on Energy and Commerce
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 933, providing amounts for further expenses of the Committee on Energy and Commerce in the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress, by a recorded vote of 234 ayes to 181 noes, Roll No. 595, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 177 nays, Roll No. 594.

titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 2943, NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2017

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 2943, NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 172

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2017_Rule for consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 937, providing for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (S. 2943) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2017 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, and to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, by a recorded vote of 277 ayes to 139 noes, Roll No. 597, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 180 nays, Roll No. 596.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2017_Rule for consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 937, providing for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (S. 2943) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2017 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, and to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, by a recorded vote of 277 ayes to 139 noes, Roll No. 597, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 180 nays, Roll No. 596.

titleInfo.title: SYSTEMIC RISK DESIGNATION IMPROVEMENT ACT OF 2016

extension.searchTitle: SYSTEMIC RISK DESIGNATION IMPROVEMENT ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 172

congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Systemic Risk Designation Improvement Act of 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 6392, to amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to specify when bank holding companies may be subject to certain enhanced supervision, by a yea-and-nay vote of 254 yeas to 161 nays, Roll No. 599.<P/>Rejected the Maxine Waters (CA) motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Financial Services with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 178 yeas to 236 nays, Roll No. 598.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Systemic Risk Designation Improvement Act of 2016
Systemic Risk Designation Improvement Act of 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 6392, to amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to specify when bank holding companies may be subject to certain enhanced supervision, by a yea-and-nay vote of 254 yeas to 161 nays, Roll No. 599.

The House passed H.R. 6392, to amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to specify when bank holding companies may be subject to certain enhanced supervision, by a yea-and-nay vote of 254 yeas to 161 nays, Roll No. 599.<P/>Rejected the Maxine Waters (CA) motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Financial Services with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 178 yeas to 236 nays, Roll No. 598.
